text: I have a quick question about the COS HubSpot, which is the maximum possible score on the speed performance of a HubSpot site page?
an easy way to test that is to just make a blank template with no content or CSS/JS files attached.
I've seen 100s before on google page speed and very high pingdom stats

It should also be known google pagespeed insights is weighted. 1 little issue that Google thinks is a huge deal may not actually affect your site speed. Example: jQuery being loaded in header, this only affects users on the first page load significantly. Seeing as they use the HubSpot CDN for jQuery odds are the file is already cached on the users machine meaning there is no download time for the file. Google page speed however docks like 15 to 20 points over that.

The lighthouse stuff Google is doing does a better job at measuring things that actually matter instead of a bunch of rules, but yeah be sure to test your actual page speed and don’t just look at what Google says.

Where is there an article referencing the ability to host two+ domains on the CMS under a portal account. For example, `<http://abcwidgets.com|abcwidgets.com>`, `<http://xyzwidgets.com|xyzwidgets.com>`, and `<http://widgets.com|widgets.com>`

Not sure exactly what you had in mind for the article, but this KB article talks about hosing multiple domains <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-general/use-brand-domains-with-your-HubSpot-tools>
ah so for the CMS, we wouldnt be able to do have it for two domains on one account correct?
Not without the Brand Domains addon
for example use the CMS to create a site for `<http://abcwidgets.com|abcwidgets.com>` and the same portal manager content for `<http://xyzwidgets.com|xyzwidgets.com>`
so to clarify, with the brand domains addon and an enterprise account, you can have unlimited brand domains correct?
so brand domains can be purchased multiple times, so in your original example at the top of this thread, it would require Enterprise plus 2 brand domain addons
for a total of 3 hosted domains in HubSpot
ah ok s overall looking around $4600/mo for it, awesome thanks <@UFBNA9K9A>
Sure thing
another quick question, does buying the Enterprise version automatically get you the CMS?
It does not, but brand domains applies to Landing Pages and Blogs FYI

:+1: , just seems off because in the "Features" section of the enterprise, it shows you get CMS Memberships but whats the point in the feature if you still have to buy the CMS. Just seems like something that could cause confusion for the end users
maybe include the same hover underline help text for the other items you have in features and have it say "Requires CMS Add-on"

Yup, I hear you. Personally I think CMS Memberships should be renamed to something like “gated content”.  It’s totally usable without the CMS add-on with Landing Pages.  It needs to be clearer for sure
ah yea good point

I think there just needs to be a whole other conversation about some this stuff lol. I for one think the brand domain pricing is crazy as when compared to some other platforms that offer multi-site, its hard to swallow and additional $700 just for another root domain to be used
not the first time I’ve heard that feedback, I’ll make sure it gets back to the team that handles pricing and packaging
Thanks again <@UFBNA9K9A>!

:wave: Hey team. I wanted to quickly pass along a new resource to help explain the value of HubSpot CMS. This page dives in to the importance of SEO, and how HubSpot CMS helps you implement a strong SEO strategy. <https://www.HubSpot.com/cms-and-seo>
when you move a blog post to a different blog, HubSpot automatically creates a redirect, correct?

One thing on this page is kind of misleading, `HubSpot makes it easy to manage and edit the meta description of any page.` this is not so much true on listing pages in the blog. For example, an author listing page, topic listing page, and main blog listing pages all share the same meta with no way to change those at the moment except via JS

I don't think there is important SEO value in listing pages. -- Generally all topics/tags should all be blocked from indexing. You want the actual blog posts to be found -- not the listing page.

I would see some value in author pages, if it was possible to expand on them, but I think a better option is on the team page, with a blog listing of that author showing up because of the current state.
yeah order is in there… just now way i can find to pull it out of the current module
*no

Google is usually pretty good about not showing listing pages but to completely remove them (essentially creating a noindex, follow type rule) will lead Google to eventually do a nofollow on the links as well. <https://www.seroundtable.com/google-long-term-noindex-follow-24990.html>
I agree there is probably not important SEO value, but still a value thats not really been researched that I know of

Also as this article states (bout halfway down) <https://www.searchenginejournal.com/seo-friendly-pagination/275557/> having content on those pages
>it could potentially cause content linked from the paginated pages to be removed from the index.
While I know its a stretch it's def a possibility.  Though If you have a huge site with many posts, it could eat into your crawl budget but that a whole project of needing to make sure you are using the right content on your site.
your blog posts should be in the sitemap

in a for loop and pull the name of the first one.

If I am looking for a freelancer who is a strong HubSpot Developer that is located in Chicago, is there a direct channel of some kinda where HubSpot Developers can be found on in a preferred location?
<#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>
Not technically located in Chicago, but close enough to know it’s really cold and snowy there right now(because that’s how it is here). Spin Group is located in Milwaukee if you’re interested.

<@U7SL518D6>, thanks for letting me know, yes it is snowy and cold, but we need this freelancer to be on-site to help work with our DEV team along side with Marketing, just curious I was missing a potential channel outlet while we were going through the candidate review process
<#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>

ahh.
completely understand.

Just as an FYI while we would not  be able to be on-site all the time. Our team consists of mostly developers, we partner with marketing agencies to act as their development team, or to assist their existing team, we use your companys existing tools for project management and chat or if you don’t have any we have our own. The idea being that we act more like a dev department inside of your company than an outsourced agency. Most of our work is actually this way. We have a few marketing agencies that have decided not to hire internal developers because they found it just way easier to work with us than train someone up to where we’re already at.

We’re all inbound certified and know digital marketing, design certified. I’m not a marketer or a sales guy, so I’m done pushing things, if things don’t work out with hiring a freelancer feel free to reach out, I’m always online on the HS slack.
I will say I still don’t know what to do in situations where markdown doesn’t support a thing I want to do
incoming awesome dev related announcement from <@UBFA10FMF>.

:wave: Heya everybody! Quick heads up: we just deployed a change to FTP that might impact some of your bookmarks or scripts. We were using pretty stale data to populate the company name, and we updated that to use the Account Name in the HubSpot settings instead. This is more consistent, and won't be changing again in the future -the only thing that may change here is the path to your remote site.

From our data, this will impact ~150 portals that have used FTP recently, but feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions/if there's any way I can help!
I did consider just waiting for a while <@U7SL518D6> :wink:
incoming question from <@U7SL518D6>

I like the idea of using account names in ftp, can you flip flop the id and account name though?
<https://spin.d.pr/rnigJK>

Updated screenshot to make ID’s more cryptic
as you can see when you have a lot of accounts that you have access to, the sorting by id is not great, way easier to find a portal by it’s name.
That's a good point. My immediate concern is that would impact 100% of FTP users, which makes me a little uneasy. But I'll look into it!
well the change you just made probably affected 80%?

the only ones likely to be significantly impacted are those actively using local build tools, and simply posting an announcement about the change gives them a heads up, and they can adjust their build process.

The amount of devs currently set up that way I think is pretty low based on forum and slack conversations. It’s basically Just  <@U25PYL3Q8>  maybe <@U26BLKGE4> too

lol
^ Not currently using FTP, so change away before I need to again lol

Do we agree that you can do checks to see what page (is listing, is author) in a coded template and set meta description on the blog pages -- We agree that is easier that JS. I know this isn't "HubSpot user friendly" but that is a better option than JS, and is still possible.

I also want to agree that there SHOULD be these options and I'm not discounting anyones comments here.  BUT, it shouldn't take one of us to build out a blog to make this happen as HubSpot completely drove inbound marketing as a their strategy and somehow continued to overlook this.  If that is because some of the reasons I mentioned earlier (seo value low) that makes sense -- but this should be popped in there very soon.
likely me, <@U54TVT3C1> and some others that I'm not aware of

Yep, for those pages if your doing coded templates you can totally set those up without JS. When your doing the normal templates you'd have to use JS to update those. Totally agree with you all the way that this was overlooked and should be in there.

Also SEO for those listing pages is definitely not a black/white area and listing pages and what not are always left to client preference. There are valid points throughout this thread for both sides of having it in those pages and totally just ignoring them.

I'm going to add that it might be nice to have someone close -- but the person you are looking to come to your location and develop is going to fit into two categories. 1) Is in the 150-250/hour range, will ask for meals paid, transportation, etc., 2) is in the 10-50/hour range and doesn't have the knowledge or experience you are going to need. There isn't a developer that is going to the like the situation you are putting them. If they are then they need the money more than they want to do the work.

I don't want to come across as negative here but between slack, zoom, google hangouts, and the other 100 different ways to collaborate with a team -- what you are asking for isn't ideal and doesn't really make sense. There are teams that have been making dreams reality when they are over 1000 miles away from each other. I wish you luck in finding some locally -- I'd look to here: <http://chicago.HubSpotusergroups.com/> or reaching out to your HubSpot sales rep if you are trying to find a freelancer/partner that is local.  If not -- there are plenty of options that can assist you without being on site.
we found a way to do this! :slightly_smiling_face:
